A simple report that previews in 2.2M4 Report Designer fails in 2.2M5 Designer.

Following is the exception from the Report Designer preview screen.  (I did not see how to attach the actual design and data file to the log entry).

Created an attachment (id=60761)
Design file causing error

Design file causing the error

Created an attachment (id=60762)
Data file associated with the design file

Data file associated with the design file.

The FILELIST value in the report design will need to change to the appropriate location.

Hi Davis,

The report design is invalid. It has a column binding _dataitem_1_Inventory Cost_1 bound to expression _dataitem_1_Inventory Cost_, which is invalid. It should be bound to row["_dataitem_1_Inventory Cost_"].

This syntax check is added in M5 so that it prevent this report from being run.

Thanks.
Lin

I don?t know if agree with the column binding analysis.  

What I think the problem is that the M5 does not handle the spaces in the name like M4 does.  When simply putting the name in quotes or removing the space in the field name, the problem goes away.  

_dataitem_1_Inventory_Cost instead of _dataitem_1_Inventory Cost

I think the question is: Should spaces be allowed in names.

Hi,

Yes we allow space in column binding name:actually any character would be accepted by column binding name.

The reason that after change "_dataitem_1_Inventory Cost" to "_dataitem_1_Inventory_Cost" make report run is that, for former expression, the syntax error can be checked out in design time, for latter one, however only during runtime the error can be checked out, for "_dataitem_1_Inventory_Cost" might be a variable defined in java script.

If you simply put binding of problem to table layout you will find that the exception will always be thrown out.The reason that when it is not in table layout we will not throw exception is that for sake of performance we do not evaluate the bindings that never used.

Thanks.
Lin
As I've mentioned, the column binding is incorrect so that it prevent the report from run in M5. As far as you fixed that column binding the report would be runable.

Thanks.
Lin

Hi Davis,

Hopefully my explanation above can help you to understand the domain of problem. As this bug is scheduled for M6 build, I will close it for now. Please feel free to reopen it in case of necessary.

Thanks.
Lin
